welcome.title: Welcome
welcome.intro: This questionnaire is part of a research study for a Master's thesis in Mechanical Engineering at Politecnico di Milano, in collaboration with Inria and the Rainbow Team.
welcome.what: You will evaluate material-related characteristics for a set of everyday objects. Your answers will be used for research purposes only.
welcome.ageCheck: I confirm that I am at least 18 years old.
welcome.consentCheck: I consent to participate in this study.
welcome.privacy: Participation is voluntary. You may stop at any time. No personally identifying information is required.

roughness.label: Roughness
roughness.definition: Describes the perceived unevenness or coarseness of a surface texture.

hardness.label: Hardness
hardness.definition: The sensation of how solid or rigid an object feels when you press against it.

friction.label: Friction
friction.definition: The resistance you feel when sliding your finger across a surface.
friction.example:
Low (slippery): wet soap bar
High (high grip): adhesive tape

weight.label: Weight
weight.definition: The sensation of heaviness caused by gravity when you lift an object.

thermal.label: Thermal Properties
thermal.definition: Describe how cold or hot a material feels against your skin.

sharpness.label: Sharpness
sharpness.definition: The sensation of distinct edges, points, or prickliness on an object's surface.
sharpness.example:
Low (rounded): piece of fabric
High (sharp): Lego brick

valence.label: Valence
valence.definition: Refers to how pleasant or unpleasant the touch experience is.
valence.example:
Low (unpleasant): chewing gum under a table
High (pleasant): petting a soft animal

arousal.label: Arousal
arousal.definition: Measures how stimulating, intense, or activating the interaction feels.
arousal.example:
Low (calming): resting under a warm blanket
High (highly activating): touching something electrified
